definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
old variant of 魂[hun2]
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: As he, in his swooning ears, the choir's amen.
sentences.chinese: 神魂颠倒的耳中，只想听到唱诗班的歌。

sentences.english: He lost his head over that woman.
sentences.chinese: 他叫那个女人给弄得神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: In a word, Sophia was in love with him to distraction.
sentences.chinese: 简单一句话，苏菲亚爱他爱得神魂颠倒了。

sentences.english: Actually I am spaced-out all day.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我一天都神魂颠倒的。

sentences.english: Her wit, her voice my heart beguiles.
sentences.chinese: 她的幽默风趣，她的悦耳声音，让我神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: Before him, of course, others had turned her head.
sentences.chinese: 在他之前，她当然为别人神魂颠倒过。

sentences.english: It'll drive you crazy at first.
sentences.chinese: 一开始会叫你神魂颠倒的。

sentences.english: At first he'd be charming, sexy, sweep me off my feet. The electricity between us was amazing.
sentences.chinese: 一开始他很有魅力，很性感，把我弄得神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: I was carried away, seeing, absorbing many wonders.
sentences.chinese: 我神魂颠倒，目睹吸收了多少神妙之处。

sentences.english: Across the country, female fans shivered and went limp.
sentences.chinese: 全美国的女影迷都为瓦伦蒂诺神魂颠倒，颤抖发狂。

sentences.english: Yes, Tom really turns me on.
sentences.chinese: 是的，汤姆真让我神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: I love that red man-killer skirt of yours.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你那条使男人神魂颠倒的红短裙。

sentences.english: The moment the prince caught sight of the princess, he was head over heels in love with her.
sentences.chinese: 王子第一眼见到公主，就神魂颠倒地爱上了她。

sentences.english: Her eyes can touch one's soul, which attracts a lot of men.
sentences.chinese: 眼神摄人心魄，令很多男人神魂颠倒。
噢，鲍勃真让我神魂颠倒。

sentences.english: The son is so captivate with the woman that he does not heed his parents' warning.
sentences.chinese: 儿子为这个女人神魂颠倒，全然不顾他父母的告诫。

definition: to fascinate/to strongly attract/to obsess/to infatuate/to captivate/to enchant
ecstatic/enraptured
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to be fascinated/to be captivated
charm/loveliness (of a woman)
bewitched/intoxicated by sth
to wish one were dead (idiom)/(fig.) to be in seventh heaven
enchanted/fascinated/charmed
to indulge in fantasy (idiom); to let one's imagination run wild
to be dazzled and stunned (idiom)
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to steal (sb's heart)
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
